name: Zoh Shia
description: A Guardian created to be Wyveria's savior. It was feeding off the Dragontorch, drawing from the vast stores of energy while it slumbered.

item.name: Nourishing Extract
item.description: Can be obtained from some large monsters. Has the ability to amplify the effects of certain medicines.

item.name: Guardian Scale
item.description: Contains an unknown substance. It has lost any color it previously had and possesses unique properties.

item.name: Tough Guardian Bone
item.description: A bone found in the Ruins of Wyveria. Its peculiar shape is unique to the local wildlife.

item.name: Guardian Blood
item.description: Guardian blood containing an unknown substance. A valuable research material.

item.name: Guardian Blood+
item.description: Guardian blood with rather peculiar properties. Requires further research.

item.name: Guardian Pelt
item.description: Contains an unknown substance. It has lost any color it previously had and courses with energy.

item.name: Zoh Shia Certificate S
item.description: A Guild certificate awarded to those who have hunted Zoh Shia. Used to make equipment.

item.name: Zoh Shia Crystalscale
item.description: A crystallized Zoh Shia scale. Its dull glow evinces the great energy it contains.

item.name: Zoh Shia Layershell
item.description: The coiled nature of Zoh Shia's layered shell looks as though it protects as much as it constricts.

item.name: Zoh Shia Stakeclaw
item.description: Stake-like Zoh Shia claws extended by hardened Wylk. The Wylkrystal growths are eerily uniform.

item.name: Zoh Shia Crystalhorn
item.description: A crystal-coated Zoh Shia horn. Heavy and wedge-like, as though it were used to seal something.

item.name: Zoh Shia Crystaltail
item.description: A crystal-covered Zoh Shia tail. The crystals continue to grow even after the tail is severed.

item.name: Faux Whitegleam Orb
item.description: An inorganic orb from inside Zoh Shia. Something wriggles deep within its elaborate design.

item.name: Blackember Mass
item.description: A small, swollen mass from the inside of Zoh Shia. It pulses with an alien-like quality.

features: A massive Guardian that has been feeding off the Dragontorch's energy. Its body is encased in crystallized Wyvern Milk, allowing it to regenerate. Zoh Shia, like other Guardians, excels at energy attacks and can produce repeated explosions to crystallize the whole area. Beneath its white Guardian coat, its body pulses with dark recollectionâ€”which you may see, should it reveal its full power from the days of yore.
tips: Zoh Shia share the same basic traits of other Guardians. The crystals on their wings and heads can be stripped away to deplete their energy stores. The white crystals on their bodies will grow back weaker, making them easier to destroy a second time. The crystals they create will detonate if they take elemental damage, but a talented hunter can use elemental Slinger ammo and smart maneuvering to make good use of them.

name: Guardian Doshaguma
description: An artificial species created by an ancient civilization with a Doshaguma's power. They boast an incredibly robust physique and can spew acid.

item.name: Beast Gem
item.description: A valuable jewel formed from coagulated juices inside a monster. Glows wildly.

item.name: Guardian Doshaguma Fur
item.description: The fur of a Guardian Doshaguma. Energy coursing through it has turned it white and strengthened it.

item.name: Guardian Doshaguma Hide
item.description: The hide of a Guardian Doshaguma. It is especially thick and tough, with a distinctive white pattern.

item.name: Guardian Doshaguma Claw
item.description: The claw of a Guardian Doshaguma. Energy coursing through it has turned it white and rigid.

item.name: Guardian Doshaguma Fang
item.description: The fang of a Guardian Doshaguma. Tough enough to withstand the Doshaguma's fiercely acidic saliva.

item.name: G. Doshaguma Certificate
item.description: A Guild certificate awarded to those who have hunted a Guardian Doshaguma. Used to make equipment.

item.name: Guardian Doshaguma Fur+
item.description: High-quality fur from a Guardian Doshaguma. Energy coursing through it has rendered it hard as steel.

item.name: Guardian Doshaguma Hide+
item.description: A high-quality hide from a Guardian Doshaguma. Tough as iron and able to withstand any kind of attack.

item.name: Guardian Doshaguma Claw+
item.description: An especially sharp claw from a Guardian Doshaguma. Filled with energy, it easily cuts through armor.

item.name: Guardian Doshaguma Fang+
item.description: An especially sharp fang from a Guardian Doshaguma. Mercilessly crushes anything in its way.

item.name: G. Doshaguma Certificate S
item.description: A Guild certificate awarded to those who have hunted a Guardian Doshaguma. Used to make equipment.

item.name: Nourishing Extract
item.description: Can be obtained from some large monsters. Has the ability to amplify the effects of certain medicines.

item.name: Tough Guardian Bone
item.description: A bone found in the Ruins of Wyveria. Its peculiar shape is unique to the local wildlife.

item.name: Crushed Crystal
item.description: A shard of crystal carved from the carcass of a Guardian. Can be used as a melding material.

item.name: Cloudy Crystal
item.description: A hazy crystal carved from the carcass of a Guardian. Can be used as a melding material.

item.name: Coruscating Crystal
item.description: A glittering crystal carved from the carcass of a Guardian. Can be used as a melding material.

item.name: Guardian Blood
item.description: Guardian blood containing an unknown substance. A valuable research material.

item.name: Guardian Blood+
item.description: Guardian blood with rather peculiar properties. Requires further research.

item.name: Great Stoutbone
item.description: The bone of a large, high ranking monster. Extremely solid and durable.

item.name: Guardian Pelt
item.description: Contains an unknown substance. It has lost any color it previously had and courses with energy.

item.name: Guardian Pelt+
item.description: A high-quality Guardian pelt. Exceptionally smooth and tough.

item.name: Wyverian Bloodstone (S)
item.description: Obtained from destroying a tempered wound. Has a deep sanguine hue. Can be used as a melding material.

item.name: Wyverian Bloodstone
item.description: Obtained from destroying a tempered wound. Has a deep sanguine hue. Can be used as a melding material.

item.name: Wyverian Bloodstone (L)
item.description: Obtained from destroying a tempered wound. Larger than most of its type. Can be used as a melding material.

features: An artificial monster species created by an ancient civilization and imbued with Doshaguma's power. Guardian Doshaguma cannot reproduce and do not require food, relying instead on Wyvern Milk for energy. While anything but agile, they're tough enough to charge right through attacks without flinching, making them extremely dangerous.
tips: Most Guardian Doshaguma attacks are big forelimb swings. While not agile, the attacks that carry Guardian energy will cause wide explosions. Watch out for the acid in their saliva, which temporarily lowers defense. By dealing with their forearm attacks properly, you can expose a weak point worth exploiting. The crystals formed by their attacks will explode from elemental interference, making Slinger ammo effective.

name: Rey Dau
description: The flying wyvern that reigns supreme over the Windward Plains' ecosystem. It is able to store, amplify, and discharge the Sandtide's lightning.

item.name: Rey Dau Scale
item.description: A Rey Dau scale. Its unique shape allows electricity from its organs to pass through.

item.name: Rey Dau Shell
item.description: The shell from a Rey Dau. Highly conductive and capable of producing large electrical currents.

item.name: Rey Dau Thunderhorn
item.description: An electrically charged Rey Dau horn. The thick, flexible muscle at its base lets it move freely.

item.name: Rey Dau Wingtalon
item.description: The claw-shaped energy conduit of a Rey Dau. Coated in sharp fulgurite blades formed by electric discharges.

item.name: Rey Dau Tail
item.description: A Rey Dau tail. Its fulgurite-covered spines rub together to produce a threatening melody.

item.name: Rey Dau Plate
item.description: A Rey Dau plate. The backward-facing scale accumulates a massive amount of energy.

item.name: Rey Dau Certificate
item.description: A Guild certificate awarded to those who have hunted a Rey Dau. Used to make equipment.

item.name: Rey Dau Scale+
item.description: A high-quality Rey Dau scale. Constant exposure to the Sandtide made it as sturdy as it is smooth.

item.name: Rey Dau Carapace
item.description: The tough carapace of a Rey Dau. Its complex but consistent pattern enhances its conductivity.

item.name: Rey Dau Bolthorn
item.description: A Rey Dau horn crackling with lightning. Durable enough to sustain great bolts of electricity.

item.name: Rey Dau Fulgurtalon
item.description: A Rey Dau wingtalon with an azure glow. Coated with pure, razor-sharp fulgurite.

item.name: Rey Dau Boltgem
item.description: A rare jewel that developed within a Rey Dau. Said to wield the power of ten thousand storms.

item.name: Rey Dau Certificate S
item.description: A Guild certificate awarded to those who have hunted a Rey Dau. Used to make equipment.

item.name: Monster Hardbone
item.description: Precious bone obtained from high rank large monsters. Their rarity makes them highly sought after.

item.name: Wyverian Bloodstone
item.description: Obtained from destroying a tempered wound. Has a deep sanguine hue. Can be used as a melding material.

item.name: Wyverian Bloodstone (L)
item.description: Obtained from destroying a tempered wound. Larger than most of its type. Can be used as a melding material.

item.name: Wyverian Bloodstone Chunk
item.description: Obtained from destroying a tempered wound. One of the largest of its kind. Can be used as a melding material.

features: The flying wyvern that reigns supreme over the Windward Plains' ecosystem. It has adapted to the Sandtideâ€”when it most frequently appearsâ€”and is able to store, amplify, and discharge the storm's heavy lightning to lethal effect. Rey Dau is highly territorial and will attack any and all intruders on sight. The fulgurite against its carapace emits a sound that puts every monster in the region on guard.
tips: When a Rey Dau's wing or tail touches the ground while charged, it causes a reaction that produces a mantle of fulgurite. This widens the appendage's attack range and increases the monster's charging capacityâ€” so make it a point to break these parts. Their heads may also be vulnerable after a discharge attack. Hunters are advised to bring thunder-resistant armor and ice-based weaponry.

name: Lala Barina
description: Temnocerans native to the Scarlet Forest with distinctive, pirouette-like movements. The florets they release have a paralytic effect.

item.name: Lala Barina Shell
item.description: The outer shell of a Lala Barina. Has a dark luster and is wonderfully lightweight.

item.name: Lala Barina Claw
item.description: A claw from a Lala Barina. Vivid scarlet decorates its keen edge.

item.name: Lala Barina Stinger
item.description: The stinger from a Lala Barina. Sharp as a sword, one thrust is all it takes to subdue prey.

item.name: Lala Barina Certificate
item.description: A Guild certificate awarded to those who have hunted a Lala Barina. Used to make equipment.

item.name: Lala Barina Floret
item.description: Hair from a Lala Barina. So white and pristine that it could pass for a high quality pelt.

item.name: Lala Barina Floret+
item.description: High-quality hair from a Lala Barina. Its delicate, transparent strands dance in the wind.

item.name: Lala Barina Carapace
item.description: The hard carapace of a Lala Barina. A bit of polish will make it shine black as night.

item.name: Lala Barina Claw+
item.description: A sharp claw from a Lala Barina. The deep crimson tip mirrors the blood of countless victims.

item.name: Lala Barina Stinger+
item.description: The razor-sharp stinger of a Lala Barina. Capable of piercing even the thickest armor.

item.name: Lala Barina Certificate S
item.description: A Guild certificate awarded to those who have hunted a Lala Barina. Used to make equipment.

item.name: Monster Fluid
item.description: A liquid bugs suck from monsters. Mixes with insect fluids to form an adhesive.

item.name: Monster Broth
item.description: A broth made from only the thickest of a monster's juices. Quite rich.

item.name: Lala Barina Mucus
item.description: Body fluid from a Lala Barina. A sticky, red liquid that causes paralysis.

item.name: Lala Barina Mucus+
item.description: Thick body fluid from a Lala Barina. As red as fresh blood, it contains a powerful paralytic.

item.name: Wyverian Bloodstone Shard
item.description: Obtained from destroying a tempered wound. Has a deep sanguine hue. Can be used as a melding material.

item.name: Wyverian Bloodstone (S)
item.description: Obtained from destroying a tempered wound. Has a deep sanguine hue. Can be used as a melding material.

item.name: Wyverian Bloodstone
item.description: Obtained from destroying a tempered wound. Has a deep sanguine hue. Can be used as a melding material.

features: Temnocerans native to the Scarlet Forest with distinctive, pirouette-like movements. Their fluids contain a neuroplegic agent which they mix with water to produce red, petal-like bristles on their abdomens. When agitated, Lala Barina open these bristles like a deadly, blossoming flower and release them as florets that paralyze whatever they come into contact with.
tips: The paralytic effects of a single Lala Barina floret are weak and not enough to subdue a hunter, but repeated contact should be avoided. The stinger on their abdomens makes approaching from the rear a risky bet, but when tired, the stinger will stay exposed and vulnerable. There are reports that when in terrain such as their nests where they hang from above, sustained attacks will knock them down.

name: Congalala
description: Large, pink fanged beasts. Beware their potent breath, which changes based on their mushroom diet, and stench, which disables recovery items.

item.name: Beast Gem
item.description: A valuable jewel formed from coagulated juices inside a monster. Glows wildly.

item.name: Brute Bone
item.description: A sturdy bone from a beast. Easy to use in crafting.

item.name: Congalala Pelt
item.description: The pink fur of a Congalala. The tufts of fluffy hair are an ideal material for clothing.

item.name: Congalala Claw
item.description: The long claw of a Congalala. Large and sharp, it gouges anything it touches.

item.name: Congalala Fang
item.description: A Congalala incisor. While blunt, it is tough enough to crush even the hardest of substances.

item.name: Vibrant Pelt
item.description: Vibrant hair that grows on the head of a Congalala. The lovely colors are proof of its position in its pack.

item.name: Congalala Certificate
item.description: A Guild certificate awarded to those who have hunted a Congalala. Used to make equipment.

item.name: Congalala Pelt+
item.description: High-quality Congalala fur. Stout and resilient, an important crafting material once processed.

item.name: Congalala Claw+
item.description: A long, hard, sharp claw from the wildest of Congalala, and no less tricky to manage than its source.

item.name: Congalala Fang+
item.description: An extra large Congalala fang. Its sturdiness is better suited for crushing than tearing.

item.name: Vibrant Pelt+
item.description: Vibrant hair from a Congalala's head. The tuft works as crown of sorts, establishing its status as leader.

item.name: Congalala Certificate S
item.description: A Guild certificate awarded to those who have hunted a Congalala. Used to make equipment.

item.name: Stoutbone
item.description: The bone of a large, high ranking monster. Very sturdy.

item.name: Wyverian Bloodstone Shard
item.description: Obtained from destroying a tempered wound. Has a deep sanguine hue. Can be used as a melding material.

item.name: Wyverian Bloodstone (S)
item.description: Obtained from destroying a tempered wound. Has a deep sanguine hue. Can be used as a melding material.

item.name: Wyverian Bloodstone
item.description: Obtained from destroying a tempered wound. Has a deep sanguine hue. Can be used as a melding material.

features: Large fanged beasts with pink fur and a distinct crest, which the males sculpt with plant oils and juices as a sign of virility. Congalala are common in temperate forests and are therefore well researched. They're big eaters and love mushrooms, which they absorb and then exhale as a variety of potent breaths that inflict poison, blast, paralysis, and more.
tips: The stench from a Congalala is so rancid that healing items have no effect. But you can quickly dispel it with a deodorant or by evading in water. Those farts are also trouble, but a hunter might just spot an opportunity if they watch carefully. Congalala are also known to use any breath typeâ€”a trick some have attributed to the black mushrooms they're seen digging up.

name: Nerscylla
description: Temnocerans that afflict poison, sleep, and webbing ailmentsâ€”skillfully cornering prey, then hunting it with their pincer-like jaws.

weaknesses.condition: More effective once the mantle is broken.

item.name: Nerscylla Shear
item.description: A flexible, venomous Nerscylla fang. Beware its lethal poison when handling it!

item.name: Nerscylla Shell
item.description: The outer shell of a Nerscylla. Extremely light, with a distinctly aposematic coloration.

item.name: Nerscylla Chelicera
item.description: The retractable venomous fang of a Nerscylla. Handle with care!

item.name: Nerscylla Claw
item.description: A lightweight, scythe-like claw that enables the Nerscylla's swift and deadly attacks.

item.name: Nerscylla Spike
item.description: A dorsal spike and poison sac used to drip poison onto prey passing under the Nerscylla's nest.

item.name: Nerscylla Certificate
item.description: A Guild certificate awarded to those who have hunted a Nerscylla. Used to make equipment.

item.name: Nerscylla Carapace
item.description: A sturdy Nerscylla carapace. The porcelain-white material is highly prized, particularly among women.

item.name: Nerscylla Claw+
item.description: This keen Nerscylla claw lashes out from the shadows to claim an ever-growing list of victims.

item.name: Nerscylla Spike+
item.description: An especially large Nerscylla spike, prized more for its lethal poison sac than its sharpness.

item.name: Nerscylla Certificate S
item.description: A Guild certificate awarded to those who have hunted a Nerscylla. Used to make equipment.

item.name: Rubbery Hide
item.description: Elastic, electricity-resistant hide worn by a Nerscylla. Thought to be from another monster.

item.name: Rubbery Hide+
item.description: The quality hide of a Gypceros. The baggy, stretchy feel of it is oddly pleasing to the wearer.

item.name: Sleep Sac
item.description: A monster organ filled with a knockout powder capable of inducing sleep.

item.name: Coma Sac
item.description: A monster organ filled with a dangerous powder. One whiff can induce a coma.

item.name: Wyverian Bloodstone (S)
item.description: Obtained from destroying a tempered wound. Has a deep sanguine hue. Can be used as a melding material.

item.name: Wyverian Bloodstone
item.description: Obtained from destroying a tempered wound. Has a deep sanguine hue. Can be used as a melding material.

features: Temnocerans that inhabit the Iceshard Cliffs. They weave vast, sticky webs across their territory, using them and various status ailments to corner prey before utilizing pincer-like jaws to finish it off. Sometimes dead Gypceros can be found in the webs, the hides of which Nerscylla are known to adorn themselves with after devouring the rest of the carcass.
tips: To defend against the poison, sleep, and binding effects of a Nerscylla's webbing, a hunter must go in duly prepared. While its powerful pincers are quite dangerous, they can and should be targeted as a weakness, provided they are approached correctly. The Gypceros hides draped on a Nerscylla's back are resistant to thunder but susceptible to fireâ€”qualities that are reversed once the hide is destroyed.

name: Gore Magala
description: Monsters draped in great wings like a black overcoat. They have no eyes, so instead they use a scattering of fine scales to locate prey.

item.name: Gore Magala Scale+
item.description: A deep black scale that seems to devour surrounding light, not reflect it.

item.name: Gore Magala Carapace
item.description: The Gore Magala's handsome black suit of armor, said to negate all blows.

item.name: Gore Magala Wing+
item.description: A horrifying wing that casts a hungry shadow over prey and drives them insane.

item.name: Gore Magala Ripclaw+
item.description: A claw from a Gore Magala's second foreleg. It inflicts Frenzy and generations of suffering.

item.name: Gore Magala Tail
item.description: A pliant tail covered in reverse scales that strikes like a whip, not a blade.

item.name: Gore Magala Feeler+
item.description: A well-honed sensory organ from a Gore Magala that oozes violet melancholy from its infected tip.

item.name: Gore Magala Nyctgem
item.description: A pure, jet-black jewel that imprisons and swallows all nearby light.

item.name: Gore Magala Certificate S
item.description: A Guild certificate awarded to those who have hunted a Gore Magala. Used to make equipment.

item.name: Frenzy Crystal
item.description: An unsettling crystal wreathed in Frenzied power. Handle with extreme care.

item.name: Wyverian Bloodstone
item.description: Obtained from destroying a tempered wound. Has a deep sanguine hue. Can be used as a melding material.

item.name: Wyverian Bloodstone (L)
item.description: Obtained from destroying a tempered wound. Larger than most of its type. Can be used as a melding material.

item.name: Wyverian Bloodstone Chunk
item.description: Obtained from destroying a tempered wound. One of the largest of its kind. Can be used as a melding material.

features: Monsters that drape themselves in their great wings, like a black overcoat. They have no eye sensory organs, so instead they use a scattering of fine scales from their wings to locate prey. When their sensory capacity increases, antennae appear on their heads and they unfurl their wings, entering the aggressive Frenzy State. Their black scales can Frenzy other creatures as well, making them fearsome adversaries.
tips: Gore Magala will use its wings to attack anything it detects with its sensory scales without abandon. If a hunter contracts the Frenzy, their natural healing will decrease and any damage taken will increase, but an experienced hunter knows to keep attacking to raise their metabolism before the virus takes to avoid negative effects. Target the head to put a stop to Gore Magala's Frenzy.

name: Gravios
description: Large wyverns found in the Oilwell Basin. Their highly developed carapaces repel attacks and emit powerful heat rays.

item.name: Wyvern Gem
item.description: Throughout a wyvern's life, impurities gather and form this peculiar gem.

item.name: Gravios Carapace
item.description: The sturdy carapace of a Gravios. Fused with ore by intense heat, it has grown abnormally tough.

item.name: Gravios Skull
item.description: The head armor of a Gravios, hardened by its own heat. Makes it hard to work with, too.

item.name: Gravios Pleura+
item.description: Shell that covers a Gravios's torso. It's grown so thick over time that average attacks do nothing to it.

item.name: Gravios Medulla
item.description: Though hard to extract and hard to craft, the brain stem is an especially precious Gravios part.

item.name: Gravios Wing
item.description: The hefty wing of a Gravios. Recently, the demand and value of the material has been rising.

item.name: Gravios Certificate S
item.description: A Guild certificate awarded to those who have hunted a Gravios. Used to make equipment.

item.name: Firecell Stone
item.description: A magma-like deposit that only trained hands can handle. Armor made from it is first-class.

item.name: Inferno Sac
item.description: A monster organ filled with powder that ignites if it so much as touches air. Danger!

item.name: Coma Sac
item.description: A monster organ filled with a dangerous powder. One whiff can induce a coma.

item.name: Wyverian Bloodstone (S)
item.description: Obtained from destroying a tempered wound. Has a deep sanguine hue. Can be used as a melding material.

item.name: Wyverian Bloodstone
item.description: Obtained from destroying a tempered wound. Has a deep sanguine hue. Can be used as a melding material.

item.name: Wyverian Bloodstone (L)
item.description: Obtained from destroying a tempered wound. Larger than most of its type. Can be used as a melding material.

features: Large wyverns found in Oilwell Basin. They have a developed physique, powerful heat rays, and a host of gases they can emit from their body. Their bony carapaces are famously tough but expose a surprisingly brittle interior once destroyed.
tips: It's no easy task breaking through that heavy armor covering a Gravios head to talon, but repeated attacks will eventually make a crack. Thatâ€”and the weaknesses a Gravios exposes in its carapace during certain attacksâ€”are your chances to deliver Focus Strikes, demolish it piece by piece, and create even more opportunities.

name: Guardian Arkveld
description: An artificial species created by an ancient civilization based on a presumed extinct, legendary monster called Arkveld.

item.name: Nourishing Extract
item.description: Can be obtained from some large monsters. Has the ability to amplify the effects of certain medicines.

item.name: Guardian Scale
item.description: Contains an unknown substance. It has lost any color it previously had and possesses unique properties.

item.name: Tough Guardian Bone
item.description: A bone found in the Ruins of Wyveria. Its peculiar shape is unique to the local wildlife.

item.name: Guardian Blood
item.description: Guardian blood containing an unknown substance. A valuable research material.

item.name: Guardian Pelt
item.description: Contains an unknown substance. It has lost any color it previously had and courses with energy.

features: An artificial species created by an ancient civilization and imbued with the power of a monster called Arkveld. It cannot reproduce and does not require food, relying instead on Wyvern Milk for energy. In addition to absorbing and discharging energy the way other Guardians do, Guardian Arkveld can also absorb elemental energy through the chainblades on its wings and use it for sustenance.
tips: Guardian Arkveld use retractable chainblades on their wings to attack. Not only are the blades used to absorb and release energy like other Guardians, but they can also convert the energy to the dragon element and discharge it, which will trigger an explosion of the same element if it comes into contact with Wylkrystals. The crystals formed by their attacks will explode from elemental interference, making Slinger ammo effective.

name: Quematrice
description: Brute wyverns that spread flammable vapor which they then ignite with their tails. They subsist on prey stolen from other predators.

item.name: Quematrice Scale
item.description: The scale of a Quematrice. Its fine texture acts as a natural file used to grind and polish armor.

item.name: Quematrice Hide
item.description: The hide of a Quematrice. Quite thick despite its wrinkly form, it is highly resistant to fire.

item.name: Quematrice Crest
item.description: The crest of a Quematrice. Its flamboyant red color serves as a decoy to would-be predators.

item.name: Quematrice Tail
item.description: The tail of a Quematrice. Its many pleats scrape against each other to create sparks.

item.name: Wyvern Gem
item.description: Throughout a wyvern's life, impurities gather and form this peculiar gem.

item.name: Quematrice Igniter
item.description: Flammable fluids from a Quematrice, expelled as a gas then ignited by sparks from its coarse tail.

item.name: Quematrice Certificate
item.description: A Guild certificate awarded to those who have hunted a Quematrice. Used to make equipment.

item.name: Quematrice Scale+
item.description: A high-quality Quematrice scale. Its keen ridges allow it to cleave stone in a single stroke.

item.name: Quematrice Hide+
item.description: Fine Quematrice hide, hardened by the struggle to survive. Offers exceptional fire protection.

item.name: Quematrice Igniter+
item.description: Especially viscous fluid from a Quematrice. The gas it releases burns at a perilous temperature.

item.name: Quematrice Crest+
item.description: The large crest of a Quematrice. Colored an angry red and shaken violently in a show of aggression.

item.name: Quematrice Certificate S
item.description: A Guild certificate awarded to those who have hunted a Quematrice. Used to make equipment.

item.name: Wyverian Bloodstone Shard
item.description: Obtained from destroying a tempered wound. Has a deep sanguine hue. Can be used as a melding material.

item.name: Wyverian Bloodstone (S)
item.description: Obtained from destroying a tempered wound. Has a deep sanguine hue. Can be used as a melding material.

item.name: Wyverian Bloodstone
item.description: Obtained from destroying a tempered wound. Has a deep sanguine hue. Can be used as a melding material.

features: Brute wyverns with disproportionately long tails. They spread a flammable substance which vaporizes quickly, then ignite it by dragging their tails along the ground. By nature, Quematrice rarely hunt their own prey, and instead scavenge herbivore carrion left behind by other predators. This often leads to confrontations with other, smaller carnivores.
tips: Keep an eye on where flammable material settles on the ground to gauge how much a Quematrice's fire will spread. Since they rely on their tails to attack from a distance as well as to start blazes, a hunter can weaken this monster significantly by cutting it off.

name: Doshaguma
description: Rugged, territorial fanged beasts that exhibit an aggressive disposition and inhabit a large range. Sometimes observed in large packs.

item.name: Doshaguma Hide
item.description: A Doshaguma hide. The numerous scars on its body are proof of its beastly, aggressive nature.

item.name: Doshaguma Fur
item.description: Doshaguma fur. It makes a durable crafting material thanks to its stiff, bristly texture.

item.name: Doshaguma Claw
item.description: A Doshaguma claw. Sharp as it is tough, it can cut through muscled prey without a single chip.

item.name: Doshaguma Fang

features: Fanged beasts that are sometimes seen traveling in packs. Ruggedly built and extremely aggressive, Doshaguma won't hesitate to throw everything they've got at enemiesâ€”even other small monsters. They have been known to take prey back to their dens, which sometimes leads to violent disputes.
tips: When Doshaguma are low on health, their wounds open exposing a weak point. They'll grow more aggressive, though, so beware of counterattacks. Their stomachs are exposed when rising to their hind legs, which is a relatively soft target and potential weak point. Use their mobility to lure them into rock and vine traps. If a Doshaguma pack attacks during a separate hunt, dung pods and large dung pods are a hunter's best friend.

name: Balahara

item.name: Sturdy Bone

features: Desert-dwelling leviathans that build carapaces out of the fulgurite formed by lightning strikes. They use their flexible skeletons and serpentine bodies to create quicksand traps for unwary prey. Inside their mouths are multiple eye-like sensory organs. The mucus they secrete contains luminous bacteria and is believed to aid visibility while they are submerged and other low-light conditions like sandstorms.
tips: The interior of a Balahara's mouth is a soft target that can be exploited if you strike right after it expels mucus. Since they rely on heightened hearing while submerged, sonic bombs or screamer podsâ€”obtainable from Baunosâ€”are highly effective. Sometimes the large monster you're hunting will get sucked into a Balahara sand pit...but there's nothing stopping you from going after it.

name: Rathian
description: The "Queen of the Land," these female fire-breathing wyverns are known for their powerful legs and lethal, poison-secreting tails.

features: Fire-breathing female wyverns known as the "Queens of the Land." Their powerful legs and venomous tails make them efficient ground hunters. At times, Rathian and Rathalos can be sighted hunting as a couple. After laying eggs, Rathian are extremely watchful of their nests. Proceed with extra caution, as a mother will move swiftly to protect her young.
tips: Hunters will need to maneuver carefully to avoid the potent venom in the Rathian's tail spikes and her wide attack range. By severing the tail, you can limit her reach and gain the upper hand. After breathing fire, the inside of the Rathian's mouth becomes tender, making it a prime target to strike.

name: Chatacabra

features: Amphibians that use their long tongues to seize and devour prey such as Bulaqchi. Their evolved forelimbs store a sticky mucus-like substance. When agitated, Chatacabra rub their forelimbs against the ground to collect stone and ore, widening the range and destructiveness of their blows.
tips: The Chatacabra's soft tongue is the place to strike; look for openings after their attacks or when they become tired. Destroying the ore stuck to their forelimbs will leave them wide open to attack. They roam a wide area, so environmental elements like falling boulders or Flashflies will be useful in taking them down. To give you an idea of how hungry these things can get, some hunters have witnessed them swallowing entire barrels during their charges.

name: Mizutsune

features: Specially evolved leviathans with sleek, lithe bodies, Mizutsune can secrete a peculiar foam that covers their foes in immobilizing bubbles. Once their prey's movement is impaired, they'll close in with spry, dance-like movements.
tips: The foam of a Mizutsune allows it to move with incredible agility even on land, but that's not all. Different kinds of foam produce unique effects, such as inflicting bubbleblight, healing hunters, or boosting your attacks. They can even employ an explosive foam when angered. If you are inflicted with bubbleblight, you'll be left open for longer after taking an attack, so fix yourself up quickly with a cleanser.

features: An artificial monster species created by an ancient civilization and imbued with Fulgur Anjanath's power. Guardian Fulgur Anjanath cannot reproduce and do not require food, relying instead on Wyvern Milk for energy. Not only can the lightning charged in their bodies be released as an attack, they can also use it to empower themselves and perform vicious biting attacks.
tips: A hunter must watch out for a Guardian Fulgur Anjanath's sparks and teeth. While their lightning attacks alone are a threat, their maws infused with Guardian energy will cause wide-range explosions. Try to topple one by aggressively targeting its legs. The crystals that form from their attacks will explode through elemental interference, so Slinger ammo can also be effective.

features: Leviathans that inhabit the Iceshard Cliffs. They have sharp, pincer-like tails and peculiar membranes on their necks that catch the wind and keep them aloft. Hirabami can sometimes be sighted nesting in groups along the cliffs, using their scales or foreclaws to cling to walls or ceilings while they sleep.
tips: Hirabami can remain aloft as they maneuver skillfully between the ground and the sky. You'll need to watch out for those tail claws, but handle an attack well to turn it into a counterstrike opportunity. Destroying the membrane on their necks will lower their guards while aloft. Furthermore, you can target the membrane wound to knock them out of the air, making this a prime target.

features: Bird wyverns with impressive beaks and large ears. They tend to be skittish but will sometimes initiate attacks on a perceived threat. Yian Kut-Ku arrive in large groups during the season of Plenty in the Scarlet Forest. The absence of eggs or young suggests that the purpose of this is not to breed, but rather to seek out mates and nourishment.
tips: The Yian Kut-Ku's superior hearing comes with great sensitivity to sound. A loud noise is sometimes all it takes to stop them in their tracks, reason enough to make liberal use of sonic bombs. But there's a catch: once a Yian Kut-Ku comes back to itself, it's going to be really flocking mad and come at a hunter even more viciously than before.

name: Rompopolo

item.name: Wyverian Bloodstone

features: Dappled brute wyverns that prowl Oilwell Basin. They use their tails to inject gas into the ground and detonate it, then feed on the small creatures that are unearthed. The toxic gas they spray from their tongues serve to weaken prey, which they then finish off with the blasts. Rompopolo are extremely territorial and will readily engage their own kind.
tips: Hunters must be wary of the Rompopolo's poisonous explosions. Gas sacs can be found all over their bodies; the anterior ones contain poison, while the posterior sacs are for explosions. If you see one start to swell, strike it to shrink it back down. When fighting in oilsilt, the blasts will kick up rubble that can act as stable footholds.

name: Arkveld
description: A wyvern with chain-like wings. The flexible chainblades on their wings are used to mow down prey and absorb elemental energy.

item.name: Arkveld Certificate S

item.name: Monster Hardbone

item.name: Wyverian Bloodstone Chunk
item.description: Obtained from destroying a tempered wound. One of the largest of its kind. Can be used as a melding material.

features: A flying wyvern that was considered extinct according to documents left behind by the Guild. Their wings have a unique, chain-like blade that can extend and retract freely to reap their prey. They feed on elemental energy absorbed through these chainblades, and are able to convert the energy to unleash dragon element attacks.
tips: The more energy this monster absorbs, the more ferocious its attacks become. Once they fill their energy tanks, their chainblades will sweep out to attack an even wider area. Conversely, since their wings possess organs that absorb energy, a hunter can force the energy to leak out by focusing attacks there. Flooding them with continuous elemental attacks will eventually overload the organs, forcing the monster out of its enhanced state.

name: Ajarakan
description: Fanged beasts that adhere metal to their bodies and use friction to heat and cause explosions. They move in groups during the Firespring.

item.name: Ajarakan Scale

item.name: Ajarakan Shell

item.name: Ajarakan Ridge

item.name: Ajarakan Jewel

item.name: Ajarakan Marrow

item.name: Ajarakan Jewel+

item.name: Ajarakan Medulla
item.description: The brainstem of an Ajarakan. Constantly burning, as if all its body heat is concentrated within.

item.name: Ajarakan Certificate S
item.description: A Guild certificate awarded to those who have hunted an Ajarakan. Used to make equipment.

item.name: Wyverian Bloodstone (S)
item.description: Obtained from destroying a tempered wound. Has a deep sanguine hue. Can be used as a melding material.

item.name: Wyverian Bloodstone
item.description: Obtained from destroying a tempered wound. Has a deep sanguine hue. Can be used as a melding material.

item.name: Wyverian Bloodstone (L)
item.description: Obtained from destroying a tempered wound. Larger than most of its type. Can be used as a melding material.

features: Characteristic by their highly developed carapaces, Ajarakan wrap themselves in molten metal that they rub together to heat up and create explosions. Presumably due to the friction of the metal, they can reach high enough temperatures to melt even the ground or bullets. They can also use their strong limbs to grip onto the ceiling and move around freely, so a hunter must watch out from every angle, including above.
tips: Approaching an Ajarakan's extreme heat will sap your health, so use cool drinks or Chillmantle Bugs to counteract it. Normal Ammo and arrows will melt if you try to pierce their molten carapaces, so you must use heat-resistant equipment or hit them with Watermoss to bring down their temperature first. Continuous friction will cause their body temperature to rise, but soften their outer shells.

features: Wyverns that can stun enemies by striking their prominent crests to produce powerful flashes of light. Their stretchy, rubbery hide resists blunt impacts and reduces the effectiveness of shock traps. A smart hunter knows to maneuver carefully around the poisonous filth they spew, which drips from ceilings or down slopes.
tips: Faced with a Gypceros, a hunter has two headaches to deal with: the poison and the flashes. The poison will pool and hamper your movements, but you can clear it away with some watermoss. As for the flashes, destroying its crest will stop them; in the meantime, it's a good idea to take cover. If you can see its crest glow before the attack, that means you're still inside the dazzling danger radius.

item.name: Xu Wu Umbragem

features: Cephalopod predators whose prey include Guardian monsters. The mucus secreted from their tentacles hardens quickly into sharp edges that resemble blades or spears, which is why some call Xu Wu the "Piercing Assassin." The sizable mouth hidden on their underside allows them to devour even rather large prey.
tips: Due to their predatory nature, you can expect Xu Wu to attack Guardians inside their habitat. They have no eyes, but their other senses are developed and they excel at catching prey off guard, especially with their ability to enter small crevices and crawl quickly across the ground. When one exposes its mouth, that means a deadly attack is coming, but with a powerful blow, you might be able to topple the creature.

features: An artificial monster species created by an ancient civilization and imbued with Rathalos's power. Guardian Rathalos cannot reproduce and do not require food, relying instead on Wyvern Milk for energy. Just like the original Rathalos, they are superior fliers and will attack more violently with their claws while airborne.
tips: The unique Guardian energy from Guardian Rathalos's claw attacks is explosive and dangerous. This energy will cause wyvern milk on the ground to crystalize, and if these crystals are hit by the monster's fire attacks it will cause an explosion of the same element. Given that they are triggered by elemental interference, Slinger ammo could be used effectively against them.

features: The leviathan that reigns supreme over the Scarlet Forest's ecosystem. It has adapted to water-rich environments and is sighted most often during the Downpour. Uth Duna's secretions when combined with water form a protective veil that not only absorbs hostile blows but also adds weight, which it slams down with enough force to sweep away surrounding threats in the resulting wave.
tips: Seeing as an Uth Duna's veil reduces attack damage, the first order of business is to dispel it quickly. It will fall away once it loses enough water, but that's not entirely good news; without the veil weighing the monster down, an Uth Duna will become more agile and aggressive. You can dodge their wave with some creative evading, or by using things like Wedge Beetles to escape upward.

features: A leviathan that sits at the peak of the Iceshard Cliffs' ecosystem. It surrounds its massive form in cold temperatures via ridge-like cooling organs across its body; the frost its limbs produce doubles as a potent weapon and a way to travel along walls and floating rocks.
tips: Every part of Jin Dahaad's massive body is capable of powerful freezing attacks. Diminish their offensive capabilities by attacking the ridges that they use for cooling. The largest ridges on their back are particularly powerful and should be destroyed, but the hide there is very tough unless the other ridges are dealt with first.

features: The cephalopod that reigns supreme over Oilwell Basin's ecosystem. Usually, when sighted, Nu Udra is covered in oilsilt, but when enraged it will ignite the coating, transfiguring itself into a horror of flame. The oculi that appear on its body and many arms are presumed to be sensory organs, but the truth is still being investigated.
tips: Each of a Nu Udra's many unique tentacles can be severed. But watch out when they get angry and burst into flame. You can douse any parts that are burning with watermossâ€” a recommended strategy, since it will leave the monster weakened. A Nu Udra's soft body allows them to slip through crevasses and move in surprising ways, so be careful not to let them get the jump on you.

features: An artificial monster species created by an ancient civilization and imbued with Ebony Odogaron's power. Guardian Ebony Odogaron cannot reproduce and do not require food, relying instead on Wyvern Milk for energy. They will attempt to corner targets with flurries of attacks from their well-developed claws and tails.
tips: Guardian Ebony Odogaron are most notable for their honed claws that induce bleeding and dexterous tails, both of which carry Guardian energy that can trigger explosions. If their dragon-element attacks connect with Wylkrystals, it will cause an explosion of the same element. However, since the crystals are triggered through elemental interference Slinger ammo can also be used effectively.

name: Rathalos
description: Fearsome wyverns known as "Kings of the Skies." Armed with powerful poison claws, they use their aerial prowess to descend on prey from above.

features: Fearsome male wyverns known as the "Kings of the Skies." Alongside the Rathian, they stake out a wide territory around their nests, and it is the male's role to watch from above. Armed with powerful poisonous claws and fiery breath, Rathalos use their aerial prowess to descend on invaders.
tips: As Kings of the Skies, Rathalos will attack with a variety of aerial strikes. A bright flash should be enough to disorient them and bring them down. When Rathalos are in trouble, their Rathian mates may swoop in to help, so be sure to have dung pods and large dung pods at the ready.

name: Blangonga
description: Large, white fanged beasts that rule over other Blango, attacking as a pack. They exhibit a range of mobility, particularly in snowy climes.

item.name: Blangonga Whisker
item.description: A glorious mustache is the mark and pride of a Blangonga leader, a symbol of its might.

item.name: Blangonga Tail
item.description: The tail of a Blangonga. The silky, lustrous coat is heavenly to the touch.

item.name: Blangonga Certificate S

item.name: Great Stoutbone

item.name: Wyverian Bloodstone (S)

item.name: Wyverian Bloodstone

item.name: Wyverian Bloodstone (L)

features: Large, white fanged beasts that rule over other Blango, attacking intruders as a pack. Its muscularity and mobility allows it to strike swiftly, even on fresh snow, and pounce from long distancesâ€”so hunters with long-range weapons still need to stay on guard. Large tusks are the mark of a powerful leader.
tips: Blangonga use snowy ground to their advantage for extra mobility, and can summon other Blangos to gang up on unwary hunters. Use extra caution when they're angry, because they can direct the whole pack at a chosen target with perilous efficiency. Watch out for that freezing breath, too. Destroying a Blangonga's tusks is believed to undermine its authority with the other Blangos, disrupting their teamwork.

name: Lagiacrus
description: Leviathans that exist at the top of the aquatic food chain. They have appeared in the waters of the Scarlet Forest, drawn in by its fertile environment.

item.name: Monster Hardbone
item.description: Precious bone obtained from high rank large monsters. Their rarity makes them highly sought after.

item.name: Wyverian Bloodstone (L)

item.name: Lagiacrus Certificate S
item.description: A Guild certificate awarded to those who have hunted a Lagiacrus. Used to make equipment.

item.name: Lagiacrus Scale+
item.description: A high-quality Lagiacrus scale. Both its robustness and beautiful blue hue are truly breathtaking.

item.name: Lagiacrus Hide+
item.description: A fine hide taken from a Lagiacrus. It's quite strong and immensely flexible.

item.name: Lagiacrus Shockspike
item.description: The spike from a Lagiacrus's back. Safe to handle since it's used to release electricity, not generate it.

item.name: Lagiacrus Horn+
item.description: A fine horn taken from a strong Lagiacrus. Merely having one on hand is enough to draw attention.

item.name: Lagiacrus Tail
item.description: The tail of a Lagiacrus. Used not only in weaponcraft, a certain village also considers it a delicacy.

item.name: Lagiacrus Claw+
item.description: The sharp claw of a Lagiacrus. Though unremarkable at a glance, a single strike from it can be fatal.

item.name: Lagiacrus Sapphire
item.description: A deep azure gem formed inside a Lagiacrus. The sound of rippling water can be heard from its core.

features: Leviathans that exist atop the vast aquatic food chain. Lagiacrus generate electricity via their hides to store in their spinal organs, and are capable of discharging a current strong enough to boil the seawater around them. They have been sighted fighting other monsters in the Scarlet Forest, presumably drawn in from other regions in search of prey and more fertile environs.
tips: The glow of a Lagiacrus's shockspikes are proportional to the amount of electricity they gradually store while attacking. Notably, a brightly glowing shockspike when they are submerged is a good indicator that an intense electrical attack is soon to follow. Attacking and destroying the shockspike has proven to be an effective countermeasure for reducing Lagiacrus's ability to build electric charge, and should be prioritized.

name: Seregios
description: Fiercely territorial flying wyverns known for the sharp, blade-like scales covering their bodies.

item.name: Seregios Slavescale
item.description: A sharp scale the Seregios can make stand on end. Gouges anything it touches.

item.name: Seregios Airblade
item.description: A blade shot from the body and carried on the wind toward unsuspecting hunters.

item.name: Seregios Carver
item.description: Hooked hind leg talons that tear through armor and flesh without mercy.

item.name: Seregios Impaler
item.description: A spear-like tail covered in blade-like scales. Capable of truly horrific things.

item.name: Seregios Breacher
item.description: A sharp horn like a hefty axe that, not surprisingly, makes for fine equipment.

item.name: Seregios Scraper
item.description: A wing talon. Most attacks come from the hind legs; the wings serve to shift weight.

item.name: Seregios Dissenter
item.description: A single scale that points defiantly in a different direction from its brethren.

item.name: Seregios Certificate S
item.description: A Guild certificate awarded to those who have hunted a Seregios. Used to make equipment.

item.name: Wyverian Bloodstone Chunk
item.description: Obtained from destroying a tempered wound. One of the largest of its kind. Can be used as a melding material.

features: Fiercely territorial flying wyverns known for the sharp, blade-like scales covering their bodies. Boasting swift aerial mobility and lightning-fast footwork, Seregios use their powerful hind legs to make quick work of their prey. Reports confirm that Seregios also have the ability to launch the scales from their bodies, causing lacerations that bleed profusely.
tips: Beware of flanking attacks and their fierce hind leg strikes. Viciously aggressive, they'll launch their blade-like scales, which can inflict bleeding, and then immediately follow up with additional attacks. Breaking their heads and tail can reduce the number of scales they're able to deploy, so focus on breaking parts while healing your bleeding status as necessary with well-done steaks or by resting briefly.

name: Omega Planetes
description: An Omega frame that crossed the interdimensional rift. It descended on the Forbidden Lands to find stronger lifeforms and planets to invade.

item.name: Omega Data 1.0
item.description: Data left behind by Omega Planetes. Includes records of the countless battles it has had with various heroes.

item.name: Omega Screw
item.description: A puzzling screw from Omega Planetes. Made with such precision and complexity that it cannot be replicated.

item.name: Omega Spring
item.description: A puzzling spring from Omega Planetes. Its detailed makeup allows it to bear unusually heavy loads.

item.name: Omega Pedal
item.description: A puzzling pedal from Omega Planetes. Its incredible technological capabilities allow it to move many parts at once.

item.name: Omega Lens
item.description: A puzzling lens from Omega Planetes. It's said that peering through it allows you to see into a new dimension.

item.name: Omega Axle
item.description: A puzzling axle from Omega Planetes. Interdimensional technology allows it to rotate with immense force.

item.name: Omega Nodule
item.description: A puzzling core from Omega Planetes. It pulsates with heat, as if still active even after being removed from the main body.

features: An Omega frame that has crossed the inter-dimensional rift and descended on the Forbidden Lands in its search for more powerful lifeforms and planets to invade. Named Omega Planetes to distinguish it from other Omega frames, it plans to study this world's lifeforms, primarily the monsters of the Forbidden Lands, in order to evolve and subjugate everything in its path.
tips: Becomes incredibly dangerous and aggressive when activating Pantokrator mode. Repeatedly attacking its head will get it to focus on a single hunter who can direct its attacks. If the targeted hunter is in danger, another hunter can draw its  attention by attacking the head again. You can also attack its legs to create opportunities for further attacks, so work together with other hunters to bring it down.

name: Gogmazios
description: A mysterious elder dragon covered head to tail in a viscous black liquid that was found hibernating in an expanse beneath Azuz.

item.name: Wyverian Bloodstone (L)
item.description: Obtained from destroying a tempered wound. Larger than most of its type. Can be used as a melding material.

item.name: Wyverian Bloodstone Chunk
item.description: Obtained from destroying a tempered wound. One of the largest of its kind. Can be used as a melding material.

item.name: Gogmazios Rampart
item.description: A scale covered in the hardened drakesbone oil Gogmazios continually secretes.

item.name: Gogmazios Fortalice
item.description: A carapace studded with weapons and armaments. No halfhearted attack can so much as faze it.

item.name: Gogmazios Lacerator
item.description: A twisted blade slicked with blood and oil. Its dull edge crushes instead of cutting.

item.name: Gogmazios Shredders
item.description: Red-hot claws the Gogmazios uses to cruelly sear prey within its long arms' reach.

item.name: Gogmazios Fiberwing
item.description: A great wing too tattered to raise winds, sending instead vicious splatters of oil.

item.name: Gogmazios Thorntail
item.description: A long, vicious tail lined with countless spines. Strikes fear into all who look upon it.

item.name: Wartorn Dragongem
item.description: A precious gem formed within a Gogmazios's body. At its core is a firestorm capable of consuming all.

item.name: Heavy Drakesbone Oil
item.description: Hazardous fluid that courses through the Gogmazios's body and explodes at high heat.

item.name: Mutated Armament
item.description: A weapon material that has been altered by exposure to drakesbone oil. Needs to be appraised.

features: A mysterious elder dragon covered head to tail in a viscous black liquid that was found hibernating in an underground expanse beneath Azuz. It has reportedly been raiding weapon stockpiles across the land to slake its need for gunpowder, and during these confrontations various items have adhered to its body. Among these, most remarkably, is a formidable ancient weapon the likes of which has not been seen in ages.
tips: The oil covering Gogmazios's body can be softened with fire attacks, making it easier to land hits and exposing its weakness to the dragon element. Knowing what element to use when is key. Weapon fragments may be visible on some of its body partsâ€”break them to obtain materials. Attacking Gogmazios while it is in flight will break its posture and create openings. Beware the super explosion triggered by its gaseous state fire breath.
